intro: Onosma pyramidalis, commonly known as the pyramidal fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellowish to white flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Onosma pyramidalis is often found in open habitats like grasslands and coastal areas.
